result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Joseph Danek

defendant.name: Danek, Jesse Joseph
defendant.address: 2175 East Ash Court, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt: At the request of the defense, the plea and sentencing scheduled for 9-23-22 at 2:00 pm is rescheduled to 11-18-22 at 9:00 am.  Parties agreed upon new court date via email.

Defendant Jesse Joseph Danek in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting the no contact order be lifted. Court denied request to lift no contact order.  Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 9-23-22 at 2:00 pm for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jesse Joseph Danek in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Case remains calendared in Branch 10.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
Defendant Jesse Joseph Danek in court with Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to address bail. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with LD, ED, AD, KD, their residence. No third party contact on behalf of the defendant. If the defendant is in inpatient
treatment and upon the request/written permission of a treatment provider and with the consent and wishes of LD,
this no contact order can be changed to supervised contact. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jesse Joseph Danek in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Defendant Jesse Joseph Danek in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesse Joseph Danek appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 032688,
Payable Number: 997826,
Receipt Number: 22RP013903,
Amount: $20.00
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
